title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, covering the Patriots vs. Seahawks game in Santa Clara, California.
Tirico will work double duty, hosting NBC’s Olympic program 'Primetime in Milan' after Super Bowl coverage concludes.
Tirico highlights disciplined preparation for high-profile events, balancing duties across NFL, NBA, and Olympic broadcasts.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, California.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest quarterback to win a Super Bowl if New England triumphs.
Seattle Seahawks have the best run defense this season, allowing only 3.7 yards per carry, a key matchup against Patriots.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid for guidance before his first Super Bowl as head coach.
Vrabel also tapped into offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels's experience, who has been to ten Super Bowls.
Vrabel led Patriots to a 14-win season, earning Coach of the Year, a rare achievement combined with Super Bowl victory.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to set the NFL record for most Super Bowl wins by a franchise with a seventh victory.
Quarterback Drake Maye could join elite company, potentially becoming the first second-year quarterback to win since 2014.
A Patriots victory would make coach Mike Vrabel the first to win Super Bowls with the same team as a player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs, New England Patriots WR, aims for Pro Football Hall of Fame with a potential Super Bowl LX win.
Diggs' current achievements include four Pro Bowls and two All-Pro honors, but his Hall of Fame case remains uncertain.
Diggs is 38th in all-time receiving yards and 43rd in touchdowns, with more career milestones still possible.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots, including two decided by his game-winning field goals.
He holds the NFL record for most points scored, with 2,673, and is celebrated for his clutch performances.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated an extended halftime at Patriots' practice to prepare for Super Bowl LX's lengthy break.
Patriots QB Drake Maye was fully active in practice despite earlier shoulder issues; two key players were limited.
Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane had limited practice participation; rookie Joshua Farmer remains questionable.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Super Bowl LX features Patriots' Drake Maye against Seahawks' Sam Darnold, both former No. 3 overall picks.
Patriots' defensive tackle Milton Williams could play a key role in pressuring Seahawks' quarterback Sam Darnold.
Seahawks' receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba poses a significant challenge to the Patriots' defense with 1,793 receiving yards this season.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pleaded guilty to OSHA violations linked to a 2023 fatal worksite accident.
The victim, Josué Tiquiram, was crushed by a tail conveyor malfunction at an East Freetown construction site.
The company may face up to five years probation, a $500,000 fine, and restitution, with sentencing on May 4.

title: Here’s what Healey put up in her Super Bowl bet with Washington state governor
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey bet seafood and Dunkin' coffee on the Patriots winning against the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Washington Gov. Bob Ferguson promised to send shellfish and coffee to Healey if the Patriots win the Super Bowl.
Healey declared this weekend New England Patriots Appreciation Weekend, urging Massachusetts residents to celebrate Super Bowl LX.
